snippet: The ruling by Italy’s highest court was the first time former Prime Minister Silvio Berlusconi received a definitive conviction in 20 years of tangles with the judiciary.
abstract: Italy's highest court hands former Prime Min Berlusconi his first definitive sentence, upholding a four-year prison term for tax fraud and sending Italy's fragile government on road to crisis; ruling, which polarizes country, is first time Berlusconi has received conviction in 20 years of tangles with Italy's judiciary.

byline.contributor: Elisabetta Povoledo contributed reporting from Rome, and Gaia Pianigiani from Siena, Italy.

lead_paragraph: The ruling by Italy’s highest court was the first time former Prime Minister Silvio Berlusconi received a definitive conviction in 20 years of tangles with the judiciary.

headline.main: Italian Court Upholds Berlusconi Sentence, Setting Stage for Crisis
